channel.title: Help With VPS
channel.description:
Ok i know its kinda of a stupid question but i just wanted to know a little about vps. so is vps like a thing that will host 24/7 for me? will the server be running while my comp is turned off? and what is the best vps out there right now or which one do you recommend for a new server?
please reply as soon as possiable

item.title: Help With VPS
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan

@iCreatedHorror wrote:

There is a small VPS guide in the tutorials section somewhere, just search for that.
Also, look here. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,474981.0.html

item.title: Help With VPS
item.dc:creator: @vrac_defiled vrac defiled
item.description:
@vrac_defiled wrote:

so lets start:

vps is basically like another computer. That means that it is 24/7 (except if problems with provider) and it will stay on even if computer is turned off.

and for the best VPS possible, it depends if you want quality or if you want it to be cheap…

if you want it cheap, http://vpsland.com/ is cheap. I heard tho that their customer service is shit…
You could always go with better known providers like godaddy.com, but it will cost more

Read full topic
